title: Exploring Preference Formation Theory through Experimental Learning: Language Education Application Project

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented course for pre-service/in-service teachers to apply preference formation theory to language education.

learning_goals: Learners can demonstrate through experiments that preferences are formed through repetitive experiences and learning processes
Learners can design projects applying preference formation models to language education scenarios in PBL (Project-Based Learning) environments
Learners can collect and analyze preference change data using digital tools and derive educational implications
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
